content: This increase of $85.7 million was $6.97 per diluted share was due to lapping the 2021 combined direct/indirect costs related to the 2021 slowdown in Hard Seltzer category growth, as well as increased net revenue and lower advertising, promotional and selling expenses, partially offset by increased income taxes and noncash impairment charge in the current quarter and increased supply chain costs. Shipment volume for the quarter was approximately 2.3 million barrels, a 1.4% increase from the prior year, reflecting increases in the company's Twisted Tea, Hard Mountain Dew and Samuel Adams brands, partially offset by decreases in our Truly Hard Seltzer, Angry Orchard and Dogfish Head brands.
